author: @DarshilParmar
text: EDIT: Elon Musk ruined the API part, you can use some other APIs  Here's one of the subscriber built the same project using other APIs - https://chenmeiqiao.notion.site/How-I-Reach-Out-to-YouTubers-I-Like-As-A-Data-Engineer-c37bdddefde54c3789229ffa5a789432  or you can use a static dataset from Kaggle and then use Airflow to process it https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/mmmarchetti/tweets-dataset  FAQ: 1. Twitter removed free access: It still has free access but with limits of requests you can make - https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/twitter-api/getting-started/about-twitter-api  2. You need to request for V2 access: You will get an error but just by reading the doc you should be able to access Elevated Access   Worked very hard for this project🤞 Don’t forget to hit the like button and if you want to support my work you can join channel membership, it's only 59rs per month so that I can keep these content for free

author: @YashTobre-n5w
text: Okay @Darshil Parmar I tried this project using youtube API on a MacBook. The first thing was it said that the permissions for the key are too open so I had to use chmod 600 to go through and make that ssh connection. Afterwards, I tried using the free tier and install airflow but it was showing me some error because of which I had to create an virtual environment within the machine to install airflow, I did that. (the other option was using pipx but it had some other errors so I had to give up on that) afterwards I made sure that I installed all the dependencies on the virtual environment as well, then I edited the inbound rules to make sure I select all traffic -  my IP and all traffic - anywhere ipv4, it did not work. I do not know why. I tried with the paid tier the t3 medium that you used it still did not work. Can you help me out here? I googled and read bunch of stack overflow threads but no luck.

author: @Ramesh4f
text: This tutorial has been incredibly helpful! I'm utilizing Docker with Apache Airflow, following your technique to download datasets from Kaggle. Unfortunately, the Twitter API didn't work, as expected. Instead, I placed the datasets inside the Docker container and used Apache Airflow to filter the necessary columns. During the testing phase, I didn't use the AWS channel. I implemented it inside the Docker environment with two tasks: one for processing and the other for filtering (extracting). Your tutorial is truly impressive and has undoubtedly assisted many others as well. You're a champion! Thank you for sharing your knowledge and expertise. @darshilparmar

text: For those having issues with Tweepy and Twitter api versions, try the following code:  client = tweepy.Client(bearer_token=bearer_token) username = # your chosen account to get tweets for account = client.get_user(username=username) tweets = client.get_users_tweets(id = account.data.id,  max_results = 100, exclude = "retweets,replies")

author: @vivekjoshi3769
text: Hi Darshil! One small question. Sorry it's not related to DE but ETL. Do I need know ETL for a data analyst jobs in India ? I have looked Job desctiption of data analyst jobs in India and the US & I saw this pattern of "requiring knowledge of ETL & Data Warehouse" in most DA jobs in India where as DA jobs in the US have least number of requirements.  I don't know what is the ground reality of Data Analyst jobs in India but things like those make me scare away from applying to DA jobs in the country until I get ETL knowledge(my brain tells me that). Now I don't know heck about ETL because my professional Certification did not cover ETL so I am unable to freely apply for jobs and feel chained due to not knowing that one ETL technology. Thank you if you could help.

author: @DarshilParmar
text: EDIT: Elon Musk ruined the API part, you can use some other APIs  Here's one of the subscriber built the same project using other APIs - https://chenmeiqiao.notion.site/How-I-Reach-Out-to-YouTubers-I-Like-As-A-Data-Engineer-c37bdddefde54c3789229ffa5a789432  or you can use a static dataset from Kaggle and then use Airflow to process it https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/mmmarchetti/tweets-dataset  FAQ: 1. Twitter removed free access: It still has free access but with limits of requests you can make - https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/twitter-api/getting-started/about-twitter-api  2. You need to request for V2 access: You will get an error but just by reading the doc you should be able to access Elevated Access   Worked very hard for this project🤞 Don’t forget to hit the like button and if you want to support my work you can join channel membership, it's only 59rs per month so that I can keep these content for free
